column4: if I do `dd if=/dev/sdb of=backup.img` where /dev/sdb is a 120GB usb disk, why might dd say it completed copying only 2.2meg?
make sure your block size is correct.
I'm guessing /dev/sdb is a CD, right?
fsck frightens me when it asks lots of questions.
me too. You get over it, though. :)
I'm happy I can finally help you after you helping me so many times in #python.
it asks me to start overwriting blocks starting at block 10
I'm fairly certain your drive's busted.
please tell me if this is not the case so I can keep trying to help.
ill try a few more things and come back if i can continue

no matter the case i felt it best to get a copy of the image before touching the drive any further. if its any mechanical issues i dont want to risk something failing permanently before i get the raw image off
how many do you need to copy?
